info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 11:25PM EDT until June 13 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff is continuing.
* WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg.
* WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 PM EDT, High water conditions will continue to work downstream through Center City, Southeast and South Charlotte into the overnight hours. Flooding was lingering in parts of the Steele, Sugar, Little Sugar, Briar and McMullen basins. Stream levels in the headwaters of these basins had crested and were falling, but were still rising in the lower reaches.
Remain wary of ongoing flooding and the threat of renewed flooding overnight, and continue to heed any road closures!
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, East Charlotte, Pineville, Freedom Park, Southpark Mall, The Arboretum, The Plaza and Carowinds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FRIDAY
